repnme.cdata!:
Bulgaria - Private Investment and Export
            Finance Project and Agricultural Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The two projects are rated
            unsatisfactory. The key lessons learned are: 1) Financial
            intermediary lending is likely to fail, if implemented
            before basic macroeconomic and structural reforms are firmly
            in place. 2) Projects relying on planned reforms or on the
            impact of jointly implemented projects are built on shaky
            ground. 3) The impact of technical assistance should not be
            over-estimated. 4) The lack of financially strong, well
            managed and supervised banks, able to assess and manage
            risks, is a problem impossible to resolve in the short run;
            during the life time of a credit line project. 5) Where
            institutional weaknesses are systemic, any efforts to
            strengthen individual institutions may be futile. 6) Credit
            line operations require deeper appraisal and early
            contracting of a large number of well performing financial
            intermediaries. 7) Credit line projects require fully
            committed and participating counterpart institutions. 8) If
            the design of a project turns out not to fit a given
            situation, the project should be redesigned or canceled as
            quickly as possible.

repnme.cdata!:
Bulgaria - Private Investment and Export
            Finance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Private Investment and Export
            Finance Project consists of:  investment financing for the
            establishment of new, and the expansion of existing, private
            and privatized enterprises, including project preparation;
            export financing for financially and economically profitable
            export transactions; and technical assistance to the
            participating financial intermediaries to build capacity for
            project appraisal and supervision and strengthen general
            banking functions.
